headline: Anthropic launches Opus 4.6 in another hit to the software market
summary: Anthropic has announced a new version of its AI model Opus, further encroaching on software makers' turf.

headline: A Look At Intuit (INTU) Valuation After AI Jitters And Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: Intuit (INTU) has been caught up in a sharp reset for software stocks as investors reassess how rapid advances in artificial intelligence could affect pricing power, margins, and long term demand for traditional software tools. See our latest analysis for Intuit. Those AI fears have shown up clearly in the chart, with Intuit’s 30 day share price return of 29.69% and year to date share price return of 29.20% declines despite new partnerships such as Affirm, while the 5 year total shareholder...

headline: OpenAI Introduces an Enterprise Platform for AI Agents
summary: Pervasive artificial-intelligence co-workers will be a reality by year end, according to OpenAI.  It is called Frontier, which is a new platform to help companies build, deploy, and manage AI agents.  “Frontier gives AI coworkers the ability to reason over data and complete complex tasks, like working with files, running code, and using tools,” OpenAI said in the blog post.

headline: US software stocks stabilize after bruising selloff on AI disruption fears
summary: Shares of U.S. software and data services companies steadied on Thursday after a bruising selloff earlier this week that was triggered by fears that fast-advancing artificial intelligence tools could ​upend the sector.  ServiceNow was up 0.1%, Salesforce slipped 0.2%, while Microsoft dropped 1.8% in premarket trading after sharp ‌falls earlier this week.  The S&P 500 software and services index has shed more than $800 billion in market value over the past six sessions.

headline: OpenAI launches new enterprise platform in bid to win more business customers
summary: Frontier can work with OpenAI agents, enterprise-build agents, as well as agents from third parties like Google, Microsoft and Anthropic.

headline: Salesforce stock gets brutal reality check amid software slump
summary: A year ago, Wall Street praised the software sector as “the next AI focus.” But that narrative is now turning. On Feb. 3, many software stocks took a sharp hit as investors grew worried that advances in artificial intelligence could begin to replace traditional software services. Anthropic ...
